It works well on concrete and such, but not so well on grass or bushes. I’ll get some sample shots and compare it to the gimp equivalent later today.
[/quote]

Gimp has content aware now?[/quote]

Sure does, and for quite some time now.

http://o3.tumblr.com/post/470608946/photoshops-caf-content-aware-fill-unbelievable

item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

i dont actually agree that its better than proprietary alternatives, but i dont have $700 a year to spend on a webserver and it does the job

Read full topic

item.title: New Photoshop Technology [worth viewing]
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:50, topic:334099”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=430488.msg3188075#msg3188075 date=1271972137]

it also doesn’t have any proprietary competitors

http://www.litespeedtech.com/
http://www.oracle.com/technology/products/ias/ohs/index.html
http://www.iis.net/
http://www-01.ibm.com/software/lotus/products/domino/
[/quote]
sorry, i meant competitors worth mentioning[/quote]

They have a lot of competitors, as Mopman pointed out, it’s a perfect example of a great Open Source project that is far better than proprietary alternatives. I used to use apache but found for my needs lighttpd is better, and I’ve heard good things about nginx, but am sticking with lighttpd.

Read full topic

[/quote]

item.title: New Photoshop Technology [worth viewing]
item.dc:creator: @repacsenur repacsenur
item.description:
@repacsenur wrote:

[quote=“chri5, post:48, topic:334099”][quote author=la­wl link=topic=430488.msg3187936#msg3187936 date=1271963037]

the quality of free software is always much lower

That is not true, and in most cases it is the opposite. I would of course argue that linux is better for the desktop than any proprietary software, but it is an absolute fact that linux is far better on servers than windows or osx. Also look at what holds the far greater majority of web server software on the internet, Apache, which is free and open source.

what a horrible example. apache isn’t an amazing web server, it also doesn’t have any proprietary competitors
[/quote]
LightTPD is better, and IIS is a (albeit shit) competitor.[/quote]

nginx is best in terms of speed and its made by russians being russian myself i can concur the quality of anything our race produces is superior to anything made by Pakistanis/Indians/Chinese.

Read full topic

item.title: New Photoshop Technology [worth viewing]
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“Budda, post:42, topic:334099”]I had an image I needed this for today, didn’t have CS5, so downloaded GIMP with the plugin you’re referring to mopman, and it was horribad.
It was nothing like what I expected, looked nothing like it’s surroundings.

Then i downloaded CS5, and used CAF on the same image, and while it was not perfect, it was a fuckload better than GIMP. It made the image usable for what I needed it for, instead of a buch of random colours that had no right being in the middle of a lake.[/quote]

i’ve not experimented massively, but when used on the images used for the CAF demo, the gimp plugin looked almost exactly the same (this i tried)

it is slightly more weird to use though, its possible you were doing it wrong, i got fucked up results until i figured out i was using the wrong option

Read full topic
